2025-01-01.name: New Year's Day
2025-01-01.description: New Year’s Day is celebrated many countries such as in India on the January 1 in the Gregorian calendar.

2025-01-02.name: Last day of Hanukkah
2025-01-02.description: Hanukkah, also known as Chanukah or the Festival of Lights, is celebrated for eight days between the 25th day of the month of Kislev to the second day of Tevet in the Hebrew calendar.

2025-01-13.name: Lohri
2025-01-13.description: Lohri is a restricted holiday in India

2025-01-14.name: Pongal
2025-01-14.description: Many southern states in India, particularly Tamil Nadu, celebrate Pongal as a thanksgiving for the good harvest season in mid-January every year.

2025-01-14.name: Makar Sankranti
2025-01-14.description: Makar Sankranti is a restricted holiday in India

2025-01-14.name: Hazarat Ali's Birthday
2025-01-14.description: Hazarat Ali's Birthday is a restricted holiday in India

2025-01-26.name: Republic Day
2025-01-26.description: India's Republic Day marks the anniversary of the adoption of the Indian constitution. It is an annual gazetted holiday in India on January 26.

2025-01-29.name: Lunar New Year
2025-01-29.description: Lunar New year is an annual global celebration in many countries including India.

2025-02-02.name: Vasant Panchami
2025-02-02.description: Vasant Panchami, or India’s spring festival, is a Hindu event that includes special rituals and highlights the start of spring.

2025-02-12.name: Guru Ravidas Jayanti
2025-02-12.description: Guru Ravidas Jayanti is a restricted holiday in India

2025-02-14.name: Valentine's Day
2025-02-14.description: Valentine’s Day is celebrated in many places worldwide, including in India, on February 14 each year.

2025-02-19.name: Shivaji Jayanti
2025-02-19.description: Shivaji Jayanti is a restricted holiday in India

2025-02-23.name: Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati Jayanti
2025-02-23.description: Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati Jayanti is a restricted holiday in India

2025-02-26.name: Maha Shivaratri/Shivaratri
2025-02-26.description: Maha Shivratri is an annual festival dedicated to Shiva, the Hindu God of destruction. For devotees, is a day of reflection and meditation.

2025-03-02.name: Ramadan Start
2025-03-02.description: Ramadan is a period of prayer, reflection and fasting for many Muslims worldwide. It is the ninth month in the Islamic calendar.

2025-03-13.name: Holika Dahana
2025-03-13.description: Holika Dahana is a restricted holiday in India

2025-03-14.name: Holi
2025-03-14.description: Holi is a spring festival of colors celebrated by Hindus, Sikhs and others. It celebrates the triumph of good over evil and the upcoming season of spring. The festival can last up to sixteen days.

2025-03-14.name: Dolyatra
2025-03-14.description: Dolyatra is a restricted holiday in India

2025-03-30.name: Chaitra Sukhladi
2025-03-30.description: Chaitra Sukhladi is a restricted holiday in India

2025-03-30.name: Ugadi
2025-03-30.description: Ugadi is a restricted holiday in India

2025-03-30.name: Gudi Padwa
2025-03-30.description: Gudi Padwa is a restricted holiday in India

2025-03-31.name: Ramzan Id/Eid-ul-Fitar
2025-03-31.description: Eid al-Fitr is a holiday to mark the end of the Islamic month of Ramadan, during which Muslims fast during the hours of daylight.

2025-03-31.name: Ramzan Id/Eid-ul-Fitar
2025-03-31.description: One day of Eid-ul-Fitar, which marks the end of Ramadan, is a gazetted holiday in India.

2025-03-31.name: Jamat Ul-Vida
2025-03-31.description: Jamat Ul-Vida is a restricted holiday in India

2025-04-06.name: Rama Navami
2025-04-06.description: Rama Navami is a Hindu festival that celebrates the birth of Rama, the first son of King Dasaratha of Ayodhya.

2025-04-10.name: Mahavir Jayanti
2025-04-10.description: Mahavir Jayanti is a gazetted holiday in India

2025-04-13.name: First day of Passover
2025-04-13.description: During Passover, the Jewish people remember the liberation of the Israelites from slavery, their exodus from Egypt, and that their first-born children were spared during the 10th plague, as told in the Haggadah.

2025-04-14.name: Vaisakhi
2025-04-14.description: Vaisakhi, also known as Baisakhi, is a harvest celebration on either April 13 or April 14 in the Gregorian calendar. It is one of India’s most notable celebrations.

2025-04-14.name: Ambedkar Jayanti
2025-04-14.description: Ambedkar Jayanti is a observance in India

2025-04-17.name: Maundy Thursday
2025-04-17.description: Maundy Thursday is a Christian observance on the Thursday during Holy Week. It is the day before Good Friday.

2025-04-18.name: Good Friday
2025-04-18.description: Many Christians commemorate Jesus Christ’s crucifixion and death on Good Friday. It is a gazetted holiday in India.

2025-04-20.name: Easter Day
2025-04-20.description: Easter Sunday commemorates Jesus Christ’s resurrection, according to Christian belief.

2025-05-09.name: Birthday of Rabindranath
2025-05-09.description: Birthday of Rabindranath is a restricted holiday in India

2025-05-11.name: Mothers' Day
2025-05-11.description: Mother’s Day celebrates the achievements and efforts of mothers and mother figures.

2025-05-12.name: Buddha Purnima/Vesak
2025-05-12.description: Vesak, also known as Buddha Purnima, celebrates of Gautama Buddha's birth, enlightenment and death.

2025-06-07.name: Bakrid/Eid ul-Adha
2025-06-07.description: For India's more than 200 million Muslims, Bakrid, the Festival of Sacrifice, is one of the holiest days of the year.

2025-06-15.name: Fathers' Day
2025-06-15.description: Father’s Day celebrates fatherhood and male parenting on different dates worldwide.

2025-06-27.name: Rath Yatra
2025-06-27.description: Rath Yatra is a restricted holiday in India

2025-07-06.name: Muharram/Ashura
2025-07-06.description: Muharram, or the Islamic New Year, is a public holiday in India.

2025-07-10.name: Guru Purnima
2025-07-10.description: Guru Purnima is a festival that honors spiritual Gurus by remembering their life and teachings. It is observed on the full moon day, Purnima, in the Hindu month of Ashadh, which is usually June or July.

2025-08-03.name: Friendship Day
2025-08-03.description: Friendship Day is a observance in India

2025-08-09.name: Raksha Bandhan (Rakhi)
2025-08-09.description: Raksha Bandhan is a Hindu festival that is celebrated on the full moon of the Hindu month of Shravana (Shravan Poornima). The day is also sometimes referred to as Brother and Sister Day because it honors the relationship between brother and sister.

2025-08-15.name: Independence Day
2025-08-15.description: India's Independence Day is an annual gazetted holiday on August 15 to commemorate the day India became an independent nation.

2025-08-15.name: Janmashtami (Smarta)
2025-08-15.description: Janmashtami (Smarta) is a restricted holiday in India

2025-08-15.name: Parsi New Year
2025-08-15.description: Parsi New Year is a restricted holiday in India

2025-08-16.name: Janmashtami
2025-08-16.description: Krishna Janmashtami is a Hindu festival that celebrates the birth of Krishna, the eighth incarnation of the god Vishnu. It is celebrated on the eighth day of the Hindu month of Bhadrava (Bhadrapada), which is usually in August or September.

2025-08-27.name: Ganesh Chaturthi/Vinayaka Chaturthi
2025-08-27.description: Ganesh Chaturthi is the great Ganesha festival that celebrates the birthday of Lord Ganesha during the Hindu Month of Bhadra, which usually falls between mid-August and mid-September. It is also known as Vinayaka Chaturthi and can last up to 10 days.

2025-09-05.name: Milad un-Nabi/Id-e-Milad
2025-09-05.description: Milad un-Nabi is a gazetted holiday in India and marks the Prophet Muhammad's birthday.

2025-09-05.name: Onam
2025-09-05.description: Onam is a restricted holiday in India

2025-09-22.name: First Day of Sharad Navratri
2025-09-22.description: First Day of Sharad Navratri is a observance and Hindu holiday in India

2025-09-28.name: First Day of Durga Puja Festivities
2025-09-28.description: First Day of Durga Puja Festivities is a observance and Hindu holiday in India

2025-09-29.name: Maha Saptami
2025-09-29.description: Maha Saptami is a restricted holiday in India

2025-09-30.name: Maha Ashtami
2025-09-30.description: Maha Ashtami is a restricted holiday in India

2025-10-01.name: Maha Navami
2025-10-01.description: Maha Navami is a restricted holiday in India

2025-10-02.name: Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti
2025-10-02.description: Mahatma Gandhi's birthday is an annual gazetted holiday in India on October 2.

2025-10-02.name: Dussehra
2025-10-02.description: Dussehra, also known as Vijaya Dashami, is an Indian festival that celebrates good forces over evil forces. It spans for 10 days and is celebrated in varied traditions across India.

2025-10-07.name: Maharishi Valmiki Jayanti
2025-10-07.description: Maharishi Valmiki Jayanti is a restricted holiday in India

2025-10-10.name: Karaka Chaturthi (Karva Chauth)
2025-10-10.description: Karwa Chauth is an annual one-day festival that honors the Hindu god Shiva and goddess Parvati. It is celebrated by all married Hindu women on the fourth day after the full moon in the Hindu month of Kartik, which is usually in October.

2025-10-20.name: Naraka Chaturdasi
2025-10-20.description: Naraka Chaturdasi is a restricted holiday in India

2025-10-20.name: Diwali/Deepavali
2025-10-20.description: Diwali is a festival of physical and spiritual light celebrated in October or November each year.

2025-10-22.name: Govardhan Puja
2025-10-22.description: Govardhan Puja is a restricted holiday in India

2025-10-23.name: Bhai Duj
2025-10-23.description: Bhai Duj is a Hindu festival that celebrates the relationship between a brother and a sister on the second day after the new moon in the Hindu month of Kartika.

2025-10-27.name: Chhat Puja (Pratihar Sashthi/Surya Sashthi)
2025-10-27.description: Chhat Puja (Pratihar Sashthi/Surya Sashthi) is a restricted holiday in India

2025-10-31.name: Halloween
2025-10-31.description: Halloween is a festive occasion that is celebrated in many countries on October 31 each year.

2025-11-05.name: Guru Nanak Jayanti
2025-11-05.description: Guru Nanak Jayanti is a gazetted holiday in India

2025-11-24.name: Guru Tegh Bahadur's Martyrdom Day
2025-11-24.description: Guru Tegh Bahadur's Martyrdom Day is a restricted holiday in India

2025-12-15.name: First Day of Hanukkah
2025-12-15.description: Hanukkah, also known as Chanukah or the Festival of Lights, is celebrated for 8 days between the 25th day of the month of Kislev to the second day of Tevet in the Hebrew calendar.

2025-12-22.name: Last day of Hanukkah
2025-12-22.description: Hanukkah, also known as Chanukah or the Festival of Lights, is celebrated for eight days between the 25th day of the month of Kislev to the second day of Tevet in the Hebrew calendar.

2025-12-24.name: Christmas Eve
2025-12-24.description: Christmas Eve is the day before Christmas Day and falls on December 24 in the Gregorian calendar.

2025-12-25.name: Christmas
2025-12-25.description: Many Christians celebrate Christmas Day, which is a gazetted holiday in India, on December 25 each year.

2025-12-27.name: Guru Govind Singh Jayanti
2025-12-27.description: Guru Gobind Singh Jayanti is the Sikh annual celebration that occurs in countries such as India around December or January in the Gregorian calendar.

2025-12-31.name: New Year's Eve
2025-12-31.description: New Year’s Eve is the last day of the year, December 31, in the Gregorian calendar.
